---
title: "Manage model stakeholder types"
date: last-modified
---

Model stakeholders determine specific responsibilities and access levels for model review and approval processes for each model in your model inventory, such as read or edit access to model inventory fields.

::: {.callout title="What permissions do model stakeholders have?"}
Each model stakeholder also belongs to groups which determine which models they can see, and have roles with attached permissions which define the level of access they have to overarching {{< var validmind.platform >}} features.

:::

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] You are a [{{< fa hand >}} Customer Admin]{.bubble} or assigned another role with sufficient permissions to perform the tasks in this guide.[^1]

:::


## Add or edit model stakeholder types

::: {.callout-important title="Role permissions and role assignments determines a user's level of access."}
Please note that the stock **Model Developer**, **Model Owner**, and **Model Validator** stakeholder types are required by default for all models, and as such cannot be cannot be modified.
:::

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**. 

2. Under User Permissions, select **{{< fa users >}} Model Stakeholder Types**.

3. Click **{{< fa plus >}} Add New Stakeholder Type**. 

4. Enter the unique **[name]{.smallcaps}** and **[description]{.smallcaps}** for the role.[^2]

5. Once you click **{{< fa plus >}} Add Type**, you can proceed with managing the model inventory field permissions associated with that type.

#### Manage stakeholder type permissions

On the **Permissions** tab, you can: 

   - View the current permissions assigned to that type.
   - Select permissions to be assigned to that type.

1. Select **Edit Permissions** to to add or remove permissions to or from that type. 

1. Toggle specific permissions for that role by checking or unchecking the boxes next to the permission. 

1. Click **Save Permissions** to apply your changes.
